ai-ud8.4:1.2_0: At one time the Buddha was staying near Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s monastery.
ai-ud8.4:1.3_0: Now at that time the Buddha was educating, encouraging, firing up, and inspiring the mendicants with a Dhamma talk about extinguishment.
ai-ud8.4:1.4_0: And those mendicants were paying heed, paying attention, engaging wholeheartedly, and lending an ear.
ai-ud8.4:2.1_0: Knowing the meaning of this, on that occasion the Buddha expressed this heartfelt sentiment:
ai-ud8.4:3.1_0: “For the dependent there is agitation. For the independent there’s no agitation.
ai-ud8.4:3.2_0: When there’s no agitation there is tranquility. When there is tranquility there’s no inclination.
ai-ud8.4:3.3_0: When there’s no inclination there’s no coming and going.
ai-ud8.4:3.4_0: When there’s no coming and going there’s no passing away and reappearing.
ai-ud8.4:3.5_0: When there’s no passing away and reappearing, there’s no this world or world beyond or between the two.
